intro: Agathosma desciscens, commonly known as the Cape geranium, is a small, evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, small, oval leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is well adapted to arid conditions, making it a resilient plant in dry environments. Its essential oils are used in aromatherapy and traditional medicine.
